IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO EDUCATE, INSPIRE, AND ENCOURAGE GIRLS IN GRADES 9 THROUGH 12
IRS990.MissionDesc: MISS HALL'S SCHOOL INSPIRES AND ENCOURAGES EACH GIRL TO PURSUE THE HIGHEST STANDARDS OF LEARNING AND CHARACTER; TO CONTRIBUTE BOLDLY AND CREATIVELY TO THE COMMON GOOD; AND TO SEEK A PURPOSEFUL LIFE BASED ON HONOR, RESPECT, GROWTH, AND PERSONAL AUTHENTICITY.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDED COLLEGE-PREPARATORY EDUCATION IN A SMALL SCHOOL SETTING APPROXIMATELY 216 BOARDING AND DAY STUDENTS IN GRADES 9-12 CAME FROM 14 STATES AND 15 COUNTRIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BALANCES INCLUDED IN AGENCY FUNDS PAYABLE REPRESENT FUNDS PLACED ON DEPOSIT WITH THE SCHOOL AS CUSTODIAN.

THE ENDOWMENT FUND IS AN INVESTMENT PORTFOLIO COMPRISED OF DONOR-RESTRICTED AND BOARD-DESIGNATED ENDOWMENT FUNDS. ITS PURPOSE IS TO GENERATE A TOTAL RETURN THAT PRESERVES THE VALUE OF THE DONOR-RESTRICTED FUNDS AFTER INFLATION & PROVIDE A RELATIVELY PREDICTABLE REVENUE STREAM TO BE USED FOR PURPOSES THAT REFLECT OUR MISSION.

THE SCHOOL HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AT JUNE 30, 2018 OR 2017. THE SCHOOL'S FEDERAL INFORMATION RETURNS PRIOR TO FISCAL YEAR 2015 ARE CLOSED AND MANAGEMENT CONTINUALLY EVALUATES EXPIRING STATUTES OF LIMITATIONS, AUDITS, PROPOSED SETTLEMENTS, CHANGES IN TAX LAW AND NEW AUTHORITATIVE RULINGS. IF THE SCHOOL HAD UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAXES, IT WOULD RECOGNIZE INTEREST AND PENALTIES ASSOCIATED WITH ANY TAX MATTERS AS PART OF THE INCOME TAX PROVISION AND INCLUDE ACCRUED INTEREST AND PENALTIES WITH THE RELATED TAX LIABILITY IN THE STATEMENTS OF FINANCIAL POSITION.
FINANCIAL AID 4,720,284. TUITION REMISSION 210,000. CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT-INTEREST AGREEMENTS 23,249. CHANGE IN VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP -378,308. PROVISION FOR UNCOLLECTIBLE PLEDGES 69,875.
PUBLICATIONS, APPLICATIONS, REGISTRATION FORMS, NEWSPAPER ADVERTISEMENTS AND SUMMER PROGRAMS MAKE REFERENCE TO THE SCHOOL'S RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: NORTH AMERICA - CANADA AND MEXICO, BUT NOT THE UNITED STATES
AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.SpecificServicesProvidedTxt: TRAVEL AND EXPENSES TO RECRUIT STUDENTS TO ENROLL AT THE SCHOOL

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: EUROPE (INCLUDING ICELAND & GREENLAND) - ALBANIA, ANDORRA, AUSTRIA, BELGIUM
AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.SpecificServicesProvidedTxt: TRAVEL AND EXPENSES TO RECRUIT STUDENTS TO ENROLL AT THE SCHOOL
TRAVEL AND EXPENSES TO RECRUIT STUDENTS TO ENROLL AT THE SCHOOL
TRAVEL AND EXPENSES TO RECRUIT STUDENTS TO ENROLL AT THE SCHOOL
TRAVEL AND EXPENSES TO RECRUIT STUDENTS TO ENROLL AT THE SCHOOL

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXPENSES REPORTED RELATE TO EMPLOYEE TRAVEL AND CONSULTANTS WORKING OVERSEAS TO RECRUIT STUDENTS TO ATTEND THE SCHOOL. THESE EXPENSES ARE TRACKED BY THE SCHOOL AND REPORTED ON THE ACCRUAL BASIS OF ACCOUNTING. THE VALUE OF INVESTMENTS REPORTED IN COLUMN F IS BASED ON THE FAIR MARKET VALUE AS OF JUNE 30, 2018, IN ACCORDANCE WITH US GAAP.

THE CURRENT HEAD OF SCHOOL AND DEAN OF SCHOOL AND DEAN OF ACADEMICS AND FACULTY, ARE REQUIRED AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT, TO BE RESIDENTS OF THE SCHOOLS BOARDING COMMUNITY. IN ORDER TO PERFORM THEIR DUTIES AND BE AVAILABLE TO FACUTY AND STUDENTS, AS ON CAMPUS HOUSING WAS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT, IT HAS BEEN EXCLUDED FROM THE W-2 FORMS AS A TAX-FREE BENEFIT UNDER SEC 119. KEY EMPLOYEES HAVE SMALL DISCRETIONARY SPENDING ACCOUNTS FOR BUSINESS USE. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS REQUIRED TO LIVE ON CAMPUS AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL PERFORMS A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF BUSINESS SERVICES SERVICES IN THE RESIDENCE, INCLUDING EVENTS FOR EMPLOYEES, FAMILIES, ALUMNAE, AND DONORS. IT IS ALSO NECESSARY FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL TO BE A PART OF THE RESIDENTIAL COMMUNITY OF THE SCHOOL, IN ORDER TO OVERSEE AND CONNECT TO THE RESIDENT STUDENTS AND EMPLOYEES.
THE HEAD OF SCHOOL ASSUMED THIS POSITION IN JULY 2014.
COULUMN B REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS
A THIRD PARTY ORGANIZATION IS USED TO SELL SECURITIES RECEIVED AS CONTRIBUTIONS PART 1 LINE 10 B. THE NUMBER OF SEPARATE STOCK CONTRIBUTIONS HAS BEEN REPORTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WILL BE REVIEWED BY HELEN TELFER, INTERIM DIRECTOR OF FINANCE AND OPERATIONS, NANCY AULT, TRUSTEE AND CHAIR OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, AND AT LEAST ONE OFFICER OF THE CORPORATION. AN ELECTRONIC COPY OF FORM 990 WILL THEN BE MAILED TO EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR THEIR REVIEW PRIOR TO THE FILLING OF THE 990. HARD COPIES OF FORM 990 ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL REQUIRES EACH MEMBER FO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO COMPLETE THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT ANNUALLY. ANY TRUSTEE THAT HAS A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS REQUIRED TO ABSTAIN FROM VOTING ON A PARTICULAR ISSUE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MISS HALL'S SCHOOL USES OUTSIDE SOURCES FOR BENCHMARKING COMPENSATION LEVELS INCLUDING, NAIS, (THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS), AISNE (ASSOCAITON OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS OF NEW ENGLAND), AS WELL AS PUBLIC SCHOOL COMPENSATION DATA. COMPENSATION FOR ALL TOP MANAGMENT POSITIONS WAS BENCHMARKED IN DECEMBER 2014 USING NAIS AND OTHER INDUSTRY STATISTICS. MISS HALL'S SCHOOL STRIVES TO MAINTAIN A COMPETITIVE SALARY AND BENEFITS PACKAGE. THEREFORE, OUR PACKAGE IS REGULARLY REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT AND THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, AS DATA IS AVAILABLE FOR REASONABLENESS AND COMPETITIVE WEIGHT. THE SALARY AND BENEFTIS OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL ARE SET BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. COMPENSATION FOR ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES IS SET BY THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ANNUALLY. THE CONSIDERATIONS AND DELIBERATIONS ON DETERMINING SALARY ARE DOCUMENTED BY THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL FORMS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON WRITTEN RQUEST MADE TO THE BUSINESS OFFICE.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT-INTEREST AGREEMENTS -23,249. CHANGE IN VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP 378,308. PROVISION FOR UNCOLLECTIBLE PLEDGES -69,875.
THE OVERSIGHT AND SELECTION PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED DURING THE FISCAL YEAR.
